intro: Gynoxys visoensis, commonly known as the Visoense beauty, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in a fine, silky hair. Gynoxys visoensis is often found growing in rocky soils and is adapted to cool, moist environments.
